However, for any claims containing elements designated in any other manner, it is intended that such elements are not to be interpreted under 35 U.S.C. 112(f).

claim.claim-text: 1. An electronic device, comprising:an antenna;a transmitter communicatively coupled to the antenna;a receiver communicatively coupled to the antennaa duplexer communicatively coupled to the transmitter and the receiver, the duplexer comprising an impedance tuner;a voltage standing wave ratio detector coupled to the duplexer and the antenna, the voltage standing wave ratio detector configured to determine an antenna impedance at the antenna; andprocessing circuitry communicatively coupled to the impedance tuner and configured to adjust the impedance tuner based on the antenna impedance.

2. The electronic device of claim 1, comprising a machine-learning model configured to determine impedance tuner settings based on the antenna impedance, wherein the processing circuitry is configured to adjust the impedance tuner based on the impedance tuner settings.

3. The electronic device of claim 1, comprising a power detector coupled between the duplexer and the transmitter and configured to determine a transmitter leakage from the transmitter, wherein the processing circuitry is configured to determine a receiver leakage in the receiver and adjust the impedance tuner in response to determining that the receiver leakage, the transmitter leakage, or both, are above a threshold.

4. The electronic device of claim 3, comprising a pseudo-random noise generator coupled between the transmitter and the duplexer, wherein the processing circuitry is configured to determine the receiver leakage based on a test signal sent from the pseudo-random noise generator and received at the receiver.

5. The electronic device of claim 1, wherein the processing circuitry is configured to adjust the impedance tuner by determining one or more capacitor values of the impedance tuner that correlate to the antenna impedance.
6. The electronic device of claim 1, wherein the duplexer comprises an electrical balanced duplexer.
7. The electronic device of claim 1, wherein the duplexer comprises a phase balanced duplexer.

8. An electronic device, comprising:an antenna;a transmitter communicatively coupled to the antenna and configured to send a transmission signal via the antenna;a receiver communicatively coupled to the antenna and configured to receive a reception signal via the antenna;isolation circuitry communicatively coupled to the transmitter and the receiver and configured to isolate the transmitter from the reception signal and isolate the receiver from the transmission signal, the isolation circuitry comprising an impedance tuner configured to output an impedance that correlates to an antenna impedance of the antenna; andprocessing circuitry configured to apply a plurality of test impedance settings to the impedance tuner, determine a plurality of transmitter leakage values and a plurality of receiver leakage values based on applying the plurality of test impedance settings, estimate the antenna impedance as an estimated antenna impedance based on the plurality of transmitter leakage values and the plurality of receiver leakage values, and adjust the impedance tuner based on the estimated antenna impedance.
9. The electronic device of claim 8, wherein the plurality of test impedance settings comprises at least three impedance settings.
10. The electronic device of claim 8, wherein the processing circuitry is configured to determine a plurality of reflection coefficients based on the plurality of test impedance settings.

11. The electronic device of claim 8, wherein the processing circuitry is configured to determine the estimated antenna impedance based on the plurality of transmitter leakage values, the plurality of receiver leakage values, and the plurality of reflection coefficients.

12. The electronic device of claim 8, comprising a machine-learning model, wherein the processing circuitry is configured to adjust the impedance tuner by causing the machine-learning model to perform inverse modeling that correlates one or more capacitor or inductor values of the impedance tuner to the estimated antenna impedance.
13. The electronic device of claim 12, comprising a plurality of machine-learning models that each correspond to a respective range of impedances.

14. The electronic device of claim 13, wherein the plurality of machine-learning models comprises the machine-learning model, the machine-learning model corresponding to a range of impedances that includes the estimated antenna impedance, and the processing circuitry configured to select the machine-learning model from the plurality of machine-learning models based on the range of impedances including the estimated antenna impedance.

15. Isolation circuitry of an electronic device, comprising:a balanced duplexer system communicatively coupled to a transmitter and a receiver of the electronic device, the balanced duplexer system comprising an impedance tuner configured to output an impedance; andprocessing circuitry configured to determine a transmitter leakage of the transmitter and a receiver leakage of the receiver, determine a matching impedance based on the transmitter leakage and the receiver leakage, and determine a tuning state of the impedance tuner based on the matching impedance, the impedance tuner configured to output the impedance based on the tuning state.

16. The isolation circuitry of claim 15, wherein the processing circuitry is configured to determine a plurality of transmitter leakages of the transmitter and a plurality of receiver leakages of the receiver that correspond to a plurality of frequencies.
17. The isolation circuitry of claim 16, wherein the processing circuitry is configured to determine a plurality of matching impedances that correspond to the plurality of frequencies.
18. The isolation circuitry of claim 17, comprising a machine-learning model configured to determine the tuning state of the impedance tuner based on the plurality of matching impedances.

19. The isolation circuitry of claim 15, wherein the impedance tuner comprises one or more tunable inductors, one or more tunable capacitors, one or more tunable resistors, or any combination thereof.

20. The isolation circuitry of claim 15, wherein the tuning state of the impedance tuner comprises one or more inductor values of the one or more inductors, one or more capacitor values of the one or more capacitor values, one or more resistor values of the one or more resistor values, or any combination thereof.
